53-year-old male.context: The patient is a 53-year-old male who was seen for evaluation at the request of Dr. X regarding recurrent jaw pain.

numbness and tingling.context: The patient is a 53-year-old male who was seen for evaluation at the request of Dr. X regarding recurrent jaw pain. This patient has been having what he described as numbness and tingling along the jaw, teeth, and tongue.

throat infection.context: He had been diagnosed with a throat infection about a week ago and is finishing a course of Avelox at this time.

Avelox.context: He had been diagnosed with a throat infection about a week ago and is finishing a course of Avelox at this time.

tobacco use.context: He has recently stopped tobacco. He has been chewing tobacco for about 30 years.

loss of sensation of taste.context: He has had a loss of sensation of taste as well.

weight gain.context: He does report he has had about a 20-pound of weight gain over the winter, but notes he has had this in the past just simply from decreased activity.

headaches.context: He does note a history of headaches. These are occasional and he gets these within the neck area when they do flare up.

anxiety disorder.context: The patient does note he has a history of anxiety disorder as well.

Nicorette gum.context: He has tried to eliminate his amount of tobacco and he is actually taking Nicorette gum at this time.

hernia repair.context: Past Surgical History: Pertinent for hernia repair.

codeine allergy.context: Allergies: He is allergic to codeine, unknown reaction.

obesity.context: GENERAL: The patient is an alert, cooperative, obese, 53-year-old male with a normal-sounding voice and good memory.

deviated nasal septum.context: NASAL: Reveals a deviated nasal septum to the left, moderate, clear drainage, and no erythema.

tympanosclerosis.context: EARS: Both ears, external ears are normal. The ear canals are clean and dry. The drums are intact and mobile. He does have moderate tympanosclerosis noted, no erythema.

decreased sensation.context: NEUROLOGIC: He does have slightly decreased sensation to the left jaw.

fiberoptic nasopharyngoscopy.context: Procedure: A fiberoptic nasopharyngoscopy was also performed.

persistent paresthesia.context: Impression: 1. Persistent paresthesia of the left manual teeth and tongue, consider possible neoplasm within the mandible.

hypogeusia.context: Impression: 3. Hypogeusia with loss of taste.

CT of the head.context: Recommendations: I have ordered a CT of the head.
